arm_group.description: Arterial puncture with an insulin syringe followed by arterial puncture with standard needle.
Arterial puncture with standard needle followed by arterial puncture with insulin syringe.

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective is to compare the difference in the pain score in radial arterial
      puncture using the insulin needle versus the standard 23G hypodermic needle.

clinical_study.brief_title: Arterial Puncture Using Insulin Syringe is Less Painful Than Standard Syringe

detailed_description.textblock:
In a randomised, crossover design, healthy volunteers were recruited to receive bilateral
      radial arterial punctures. They were assigned to receive either the insulin or the standard
      needle as the first puncture using block randomisation. The primary outcome was the pain
      score measured on a 100mm visual analogue scale (VAS) and the secondary outcomes were
      procedural complications and rate of haemolysis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age above 21

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  concurrent antipyretic use in the last 24 hrs,

          -  presence of painful conditions eg fracture, rheumatoid arthritis

          -  history of peripheral vascular disease

intervention.description: Arterial puncture using the hypodermic needle (BBraun Sterican® 23G and 25mm in length) attached to a 3 ml syringe.
intervention.intervention_name: Standard needle BBraun Sterican® 23G and 25mm in length

intervention.description: Arterial puncture using the insulin syringe (Terumo®- 0.5 ml with attached needle 29G and 13mm in length)

clinical_study.official_title: Arterial Puncture Using Insulin Syringe is Less Painful Than Standard Syringe, a Randomized Crossover Study

primary_outcome.description: Immediately following the radial arterial punctures the outcome assessor  asked the volunteer to assess the discomfort that was caused by the puncture. The volunteer was asked to place a slash on a 100 mm VAS sheet. The VAS showed "no pain" at 0 mm and "worst pain" at 100 mm.
primary_outcome.measure: Visual analogue scale (VAS) score in millimetres
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after each puncture ( average within 5 minutes)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The serum collected during the punctures was analysed for the amount of free haemoglobin. We define presence of haemolysis as free haemoglobin concentration of more than 100 mg/dL.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
